Title.evidence: Title: Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Supra-Annular and Intra-Annular Aortic Valve Replacement

Trial_Design.evidence: Due to the retrospective nature, randomisation and blinding were not applicable.

Participants.evidence: Conducted at Kartal Kosuyolu High Specialization Training and Research Hospital, this retrospective observational study included 113 patients over 18 years who underwent isolated AVR between March 2013 and June 2019.

Intervention.evidence: Patients were divided into supra-annular (n=59) and intra-annular (n=54) groups.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the early outcomes of supra-annular versus intra-annular aortic valve replacement (AVR) in patients undergoing isolated AVR.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the difference in postoperative complications and echocardiographic findings at one month.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Due to the retrospective nature, randomisation and blinding were not applicable.

Blinding.evidence: Due to the retrospective nature, randomisation and blinding were not applicable.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Patients were divided into supra-annular (n=59) and intra-annular (n=54) groups.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The supra-annular group had significantly longer cross-clamp (74.44±15.71 min) and cardiopulmonary bypass times (106.98±22.06 min) compared to the intra-annular group (48.31±13.21 min and 76.63±23.41 min, respectively; p<0.001).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were comparable, with no significant differences in early mortality rates.

Trial_Registration.evidence: No trial registration or funding information was provided.

Funding.evidence: No trial registration or funding information was provided.
